thread.title: URI panel to discuss problems of urban RI
thread.title_full: URI panel to discuss problems of urban RI

author: Lynn Arditi  Journal Staff Writer
title: URI panel to discuss problems of urban RI
text: URI panel to discuss problems of urban RI Comment Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 11:43 AM By Lynn ArditiJournal Staff Writer Posted Oct. 13, 2015 at 11:43 AM PROVIDENCE, R.I. – The University of Rhode Island will hold a panel discussion about the problems facing Rhode Island’s urban areas on Monday, Nov. 2nd at 7 p.m. The event, which is free and open to the public, will be held at URI’s Providence campus, at 80 Washington St., Providence. Donna Hughes, a URI professor of gender and women’s studies, will present her report, “Gender Crimes as an Indicator of Public Safety in Urban Rhode Island.” Julia Jordan-Zachary , a Providence College professor of political science and director of black studies, will discuss her report, “Workforce Development as Anti-Poverty Strategy: Targeting Women of Color in Urban R.I.’’ Kristin Johnson , a URI associate professor of political science, will discuss Rhode Island’s efforts to increase efficiency, particularly in urban areas, in her report “Comparing Municipal Government Efficiency in Rhode Island.” The event is part of URI’s Urban Initiative, which focuses on the impact of national and global issues on urban communities throughout the country. For more information, call Tammy Vargas Warner at (401) 277-5160 or e-mail her at tammyvw@uri.edu . By Lynn Arditi
